hanzi-su-wiki:
膚

Значения

Кожа, кожный покров

Мнемоника

Упрощено. Плоский орган 月, кожа. Справа — 盧 плоская жаровня в виде чаши 皿 с углями, источник тепла в доме. Закрывалась решеткой 田 с изображением тигра, чтобы дети не трогали.

Варианты

肤

heisig_chinese_memo: Ending up in a tiger's stomach is not good for your skin, as it's full of stomach acids.
heisig_constituent: skin, tiger, stomach, rice field, brains, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
koohiiStory1: Ending up in a tiger´s stomach is not good for your skin, as it´s full of stomach acids.
koohiiStory2: They say, "there's more than one way to skin a cat", but if you try to skin a tiger you might end up in its stomach.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you look in a tiger's stomach you'll find a bunch of skin. It's really gross but what else did you think you'd find? Everyone knows tigers can't digest the skin of the things it eats.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself opening a tigers mouth and looking all the way down into its stomach and seeing a bunch of skin. Why would you imagine that? Eww.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The only person who would try to take skin from a tiger's stomach is a fool (ふ). You'll probably get your head bitten off looking for skin that way.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a fool trying to pull skin out of a tiger's stomach. You can imagine them getting their skin added to the pile too if you want.
Ru_Radicals: 匕 (ложка), 卜 (гадание), 厂 (скала), 月 (месяц), 田 (рисовое поле), 虍 (тигр)
Ru_trainchinese: fū: (графема) кожа (обычно у человека); неглубокий, поверхностный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a tiger's (虍) stomach (胃) would have a thick skin
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The body of husbands can be drastically different - some have super hairy skin and some have less hair than a typical woman.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze writing is used as a person's name. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning to express the skin, "Guodian Chujian. The Tao of Tang Yu: "Lipid Skin and Blood Qi", "Shangbo Chu Zhushu II. Lupin Drought: "Fushan, stone is the skin, wood is the people."

" Skin " is " group of people " in variant forms, "said the text": "... Group of people, but also the skin from the meat Lu sound skin, Zhou Wen group of people."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions from "肉" from "虍" from ◎, "虍" is the provincial language of " tiger ", which is used as a sound symbol in the word " skin ", and "肉" is a symbol for skin and flesh.
humanum_full_description:
金文用作人名。戰國簡帛用作本義，表示皮膚，《郭店楚簡．唐虞之道》：「脂膚血氣」，《上博楚竹書二．魯邦大旱》：「夫山，石以為膚，木以為民。」

　　「膚」是「臚」的異體字，《說文》：「臚，皮也。从肉盧聲。膚，籒文臚。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「肉」從「虍」從◎，「虍」是「虎」的省文，在「膚」字中作為聲符，「肉」是義符，表示皮肉。

皮膚(ひふ): skin

金文用作人名。戰國簡帛用作本義，表示皮膚，《郭店楚簡．唐虞之道》：「脂膚血氣」，《上博楚竹書二．魯邦大旱》：「夫山，石以為膚，木以為民。」 「 膚 」是「 臚 」的異體字，《說文》：「臚，皮也。从肉盧聲。膚，籒文臚。」
Bronze writing is used as a person's name. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning to express the skin, "Guodian Chujian. The Tao of Tang Yu: "Lipid Skin and Blood Qi", "Shangbo Chu Zhushu II. Lupin Drought: "Fushan, stone is the skin, wood is the people." " Skin" is " group of people" in variant forms, "said the text": "... Group of people, but also the skin from the meat Lu sound skin, Zhou Wen group of people."

膚字的基本解释

膚
fū
见“肤”。

膚字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fū］
［《廣韻》甫無切，平虞，非。］
“肤1”的繁体字。亦作“肤1”。“扶2”的被通假字。
(1)人或动物体表的一层组织，即皮肤。有时亦包括肌肉。
(2)古代用于祭祀或供食用的肉类。
(3)树木、果实的表皮或表皮下的组织。
(4)指某些像皮层那样的东西，如草皮、纸张等。
(5)外表。
(6)浅薄。
(7)美。
(8)大。参见“膚公”。
(9)通“扶”。古长度单位。四指宽为一肤。

膚字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　膚； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页992第28
【廣韻】甫無切【集韻】【韻會】風無切【正韻】方無切，?音跗。【說文】籀文作臚。【玉篇】皮也。【廣韻】皮膚。【釋名】膚，布也，布在表也。【詩·衞風】膚如凝脂。【易·噬嗑】六二噬膚。【註】膚者，柔脆之物也。　又豕肉爲膚。【儀禮·聘禮】膚鮮魚鮮腊。【註】膚，豕肉也。　又切肉爲膚。【禮·內則】脯羹，兔醢，麋膚。【註】膚，切肉也。　又【博雅】美也。【詩·豳風】公孫碩膚。【傳】膚，美也。　又【博雅】傳也。【又】離也。【又】剝也。　又大也。【詩·小雅】以奏膚公。【傳】膚，大也。　又【韻會】膚淺，喻在皮膚，不深也。　又【正韻】四指爲膚。【公羊傳·僖三十一年】膚寸而合。【註】側手爲膚。　又膚受。【論語】膚受之愬。【書·盤庚】今汝聒聒起信險膚。【傳】起信險僞膚受之言也。　又地名。【前漢·郊祀志】凡四祠于膚施。【註】膚施，上郡之縣也。　又人名。【前漢·古今人表】陽膚。　又【集韻】凌如切，音臚。義同。　又【韻補】叶音浮。【易林】范子妙材，戮辱傷膚。後相秦國，封爲應侯。

Basic explanation of words

fū

skin
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fū］
["Guangyun" has no cut, Pingyu, non. ]
The traditional characters of "皮1". Also known as "skin 1". "Fu 2" was passed falsely.
(1) A layer of tissue on the surface of a human or animal body, namely skin. Sometimes it also includes muscles.
(2) Meat used for sacrifices or for food in ancient times.
(3) The epidermis or tissues under the epidermis of trees and fruits.
(4) Refers to something like cortex, such as turf, paper, etc.
(5) Appearance.
(6) Shallow.
(7) Beauty.
(8) Big. See "Fu Gong".
(9) Through "support". Ancient unit of length. Four fingers wide for one skin.
skin

fū
вм. 肤
Radicals: 虍, 胃  (tiger, stomach)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you look in a tiger's stomach you'll find a bunch of skin. It's really gross but what else did you think you'd find? Everyone knows tigers can't digest the skin of the things it eats.
Imagine yourself opening a tigers mouth and looking all the way down into its stomach and seeing a bunch of skin. Why would you imagine that? Eww.
Reading Mnemonic
The only person who would try to take skin from a tiger's stomach is a fool (ふ). You'll probably get your head bitten off looking for skin that way.
Imagine a fool trying to pull skin out of a tiger's stomach. You can imagine them getting their skin added to the pile too if you want.
